articles.title: Kim Jong Un Goes Round Remodeled Pyongyang Indoor Stadium
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Goes Round Remodeled Pyongyang Indoor Stadium
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, went round Pyongyang Indoor Stadium remodeled to meet the requirements of the present times for building a sports power.
					 Going round various places of the stadium for hours, he learned in detail about its remodeling.
					
					 At the room dedicated to the history of the stadium, he heard with keen attention the briefing on its history associated with field guidance provided by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He went round the stadium hall.
					
					 He was very pleased that it looks bright and nice as its ceiling is decorated with metal plates.
					
					 After learning about the elasticity of the floor of the stadium and echo in the hall, he said it is at the world's level so that any international game can be hosted.
					
					 It is necessary to cover the floor with carpet when holding a meeting and other events to use the stadium for various purposes, he noted, adding that the stadium looks more magnificent after at least 3 000 seats are added to the back side of the platform to enable more people to watch games and attend events and the walls of the platform and the space for spectators are plastered with stone powder coating materials.
					
					 He learned about the illumination of the hall after being told that a double illumination system was set up to ensure different illumination for sports games and events as instructed by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He learned about the construction of the hall and corridor, going up from the ground floor to the third floor.
					
					 Watching data on the successes made by sportspersons in various events on display in the halls on every floor, he said that not only sportspersons but people would be pleased to see them.
					
					 He dropped in at bed rooms, coaches' rooms, training rooms and dining rooms on various floors.
					
					 At the training room whose floor is covered with quality mat he praised builders for decorating the walls with nice color with a good idea. 
					
					 He said it is good that training rooms are fitted with air conditioners and exhausters so that players may have regular trainings regardless of seasons.
					
					 He told officials to install TV sets and video cassette recorders in the training rooms so that players may watch domestic and international games and their trainings.
					
					 Noting that he was satisfied to go round the stadium, he highly praised officials and workers of the Guidance Bureau for Overseas Construction for admirably performing the task assigned to them by the party for the remodeling of the stadium.
					
					 The stadium with a long history has been successfully remodeled as required by the new century at a time when a new heyday of construction is unfolding, he said, expressing expectation and conviction that the officials and employees of the stadium would always glorify the immortal leadership exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il by managing and operating the stadium on a regular basis. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Jang Song Thaek, Ri Jae Il and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Newly Built 3-d Rhythmic Cinema and Video Games Rooms
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Newly Built 3-d Rhythmic Cinema, Video Games Rooms
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA)-- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the 3-d rhythmic cinema and video games rooms newly built in the amusement house of the Rungna People's Pleasure Park. 
					 He first went round the Rungna 3-d rhythmic cinema. 
					
					 He looked round various places of the cinema to learn about in detail its construction, specifications of equipment and plan to operate the cinema. 
					
					 After going round the audience rooms, control room and editing room, he was greatly pleased that soldier-builders successfully constructed the modern cinema in a brief span of time. 
					
					 Watching 3-d films "Winners" and "Don't wait for us" in audience room No. 5, he learned in detail about the quality and sound effect of films and rhythms.
					
					 He praised the officials and technicians of the Mokran Video for having successfully produced 3-d films requiring latest technology by devoting all their creative wisdom and enthusiasm.
					
					 He said it is important to successfully blend rhythms with themes of films in order to let youth, children and working people feel interesting in the imaginary world the same way they do in reality, while watching 3-d films. 
					
					 He underscored the need to put the operation of the cinema on normal footing by successfully carrying out plans for showing films and controlling equipment as the cinema is to be visited by many people in the future.
					
					 He noted that it is necessary to build such cinemas not only in Pyongyang but also in each provincial capital.
					
					 He said that the appearance of the modern cinema would help make people's laughter ring out more loudly at the pleasure park.
					
					 He then moved to the newly built video games rooms.
					
					 Going round the rooms, he was greatly pleased that visitors can enjoy peculiar games under the care of the WPK.
					
					 The video games rooms are a gift the WPK presented to the people, he said, underscoring the need to raise the sense of responsibility and role of the service persons and successfully manage equipment if their operation is to be put on normal footing and schoolchildren and working people are to be provided with best convenience.
					
					 He learned about the operation of amusement facilities and service rendered at the Rungna People's Pleasure Park.
					
					 He then learned in detail about the outdoor stage for performance newly built at the pleasure park.
					
					 He stressed the need for the employees of the pleasure park to manage it better as it is visited by many people and regularly operate it in the spirit of devoted service to people.
					
					 He was accompanied by Jang Song Thaek, Ri Jae Il, Pak Chun Hong and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Officials of Posts and Telecommunications Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Officials of Posts and Telecommunications Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun 
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Participants in the national meeting of officials of posts and telecommunications Saturday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay tribute to Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					 They paid tribute to the Generalissimos before their statues. 
					
					 They entered the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state and paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the Generalissimos received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, boat and train coaches they used during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair to Be Held
articles.content:
Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair to Be Held
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The 9th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair is to be held at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House here on September 23-26.
					 The fair will bring together trading companies from 13 countries and regions, including the DPRK, China, Russia, Germany, Malaysia, Mongolia and Poland.
					
					 Displayed there will be electric, electronic, chemical and light industrial goods, CNC machine tools, building materials, foodstuffs, medical instruments, medicines and vehicles.
					
					 The forthcoming fair will contribute to deepening friendship and developing economic cooperation and exchange among countries and regions.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Angola Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Angola Appointed
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyon Il was appointed as DPRK ambassador to the Republic of Angola, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

articles.title: National Martial Art Championship Goes on
articles.content:
National Martial Art Championship Goes on 
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The 8th national martial art championship for "September 10 Prize" is under way with large participation.
					 There were men's and women's sparring matches according to body weight categories in Taekwon-Do, divided into Groups A and B in the Taekwon-Do Hall on Saturday in the wake of the first day games on Friday.
					
					 An individual contest in Paduk took place in the Taekwon-Do Holy Center.
					
					 Those who took the first place in the Group A body weight categories of Taekwon-Do sparring matches were Kang Chol U, player from the Sunchon Cement Complex in 50 kg, Wang Myong Guk, player from Nampho City in 57 kg, Jon Kwang Hyon, player from the National Taekwon-Do Team in 64 kg, Jang Yong Il, player from South Hamgyong Province in 71 kg, Ham Chung Ryol, player from the  National Taekwon-Do Team in 78 kg, Ryu Hong Chol, player from Pyongyang City in 85 kg,  Kim Song Ryong, player from the National Taekwon-Do Team  in over 85 kg. Those who took first in B Group were Kang Un Hyok, player from North Hamgyong Province in 50 kg, Ri Chung Il, player from Kangwon Province in 57 kg, Rim Hong Sik, player from North Phyongang Province in 64 kg, Ha Kum Gwang, player from North Hwanghae Province in 71 kg, Kim Nam Su, player from Jagang Province in 78 kg and Kim Yong Chol, player from Jagang Province in over 85 kg.
					
					 Kang Yong Sim (Kangwon Province), Hwang Su Yong (Pyongyang City) and others came first in women's sparring matches of 45, 51, 57, 63, 69, 75 and over 75 kg categories.
					
					 Ryu Rim, player from South Phyongan Province, Kang Kil Hyok, player from Pyongyang City, and others emerged winners in the individual Paduk contests of A and B groups.
					
					 The games go on.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Kazak President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Kazak President
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Nursultan Abishevich Nazarbayev, president of the Republic of Kazakhstan, on September 2 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The president in the message extended sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the national holiday of the DPRK.
					
					 The president expressed the belief that the cooperation between the two countries based on mutual understanding will grow stronger for the well-being of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un and his family good health and success in his work and the friendly Korean people happiness and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Captains Regent of San Marino
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Captains Regent of San Marino
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Captains Regent of San Marino Antonella Mularoni and Denis Amici on September 6.
					 The message extended warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the birthday of the DPRK and most sincerely wished him happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK prosperity, progress and wellbeing.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greeting from Ugandan President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greeting from Ugandan President
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of the Republic of Uganda, on Aug. 26.
					 The president in his message extended warm congratulations and sincerest greeting to Kim Jong Un and the government and people of the DPRK on behalf of the Ugandan government and people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK which falls on September 9.
					
					 He hoped that the good bilateral relations with Kim Jong Un and his government and people would continue to develop on good terms.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and the Korean people steady prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Congratulations from Russian Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Congratulations from Russian Political Party Leader
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a congratulatory message from V. V. Zhirinovsky, chairman of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, on September 4.
					 The message extended congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to all Korean people on behalf of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia and all Russian people on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 It said that the appearance of a socialist state on the Korean Peninsula was inseparably linked with the Korean people's struggle against Japan's occupation waged under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It pointed out that the founding of the DPRK marked a historic event which paved the road of independent development for the country, adding that the DPRK today is a very powerful state confidently advancing.
					
					 The message noted with particular pleasure that over the past 65 years, the friendly relations between the peoples of the two countries have been maintained as fraternal ones and cooperation between them has been conducted on the principle of mutual respect and the non-interference in other's internal affairs.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un success in his work to carry forward the cause pioneered by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the great leaders, and the DPRK greater progress in the economic and cultural fields and peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Brazilian Political Figures
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Brazilian Political Figures
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), received a message of greeting from Renato Ravello, national chairman of the Central Committee of the Brazilian Communist Party, and Ricardo Alemao Abreu, international secretary of its committee, on September 8.
					 In the message the Brazilian Communist Party extended congratulations to Kim Jong Un, the Korean people and communists on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK which falls on September 9, 2013.
					
					 On this day the Brazilian Communist Party looks back upon the whole life of President Kim Il Sung, liberator of Korea and first leader who accomplished the great cause of building socialism in Korea, it said, and continued:
					
					 The WPK is now attaining a new goal, developing in depth the process of socialist construction, true to the behest of the founder of modern Korea.
					
					 The message wished Kim Jong Un and the Korean people and all communists of Korea big successes in their work, reiterating the traditional friendship between the Brazilian Communist Party and the WPK on this significant occasion.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of DR Congo
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of DR Congo
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, on September 6.
					 The president in the message extended the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of all people of DR Congo and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He reiterated his will to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the peoples of the two countries on the happy occasion.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from General Secretary of Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from General Secretary of Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), received a message of greeting from Lucas Nguema Esono, general secretary of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, on September 4.
					 The message said that the members of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea and its supporters are pleased to extend the warmest and sincerest congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the WPK and all Korean people on behalf of Chairman Obiang Nguema Mbasogo who is the founder of the party and its dear member, on the occasion of September 9, the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 They hoped that Kim Jong Un would celebrate the day with splendor, wishing him and the Korean people happiness on the occasion of the great event symbolizing the sovereignty of the fraternal DPRK.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Angola
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Angola
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of Angola, on September 9.
					 The president in the message extended congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the government and people of the DPRK on behalf of the people and government of Angola and on his own behalf and wished them happiness, progress and prosperity on the occasion of the anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed hope on the specially important day for the Korean people that Kim Jong Un would encourage negotiations which would help promote the mutual understanding for ensuring peace and stability essential for the development of the whole Korean Peninsula so that they may go on.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un and the Korean people successes in his work and their struggle for achieving that purpose.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Maldives
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Maldives
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Mohammed Waheed Hassan, president of Maldives, on September 9.
					 The president in the message extended warm congratulations and sincere wish to Kim Jong Un, the government and people of the DPRK on the happy occasion of marking the birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 He most sincerely wished the people of the DPRK progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Greece
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Greece
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Carlos Papoulias, president of Greece, on September 9.
					 The president in the message extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the Greek people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the anniversary of the DPRK and sincerely wished the Korean people well-being and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of Qatar
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of Qatar 
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Tamim Bin Hamad Al-Thani, emir of the States of Qatar, on September 9, the anniversary of the DPRK.
					 In the message the emir extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the Korean people on behalf of the people of the States of Qatar and on his own behalf on the DPRK's national day. 
					
					 He most sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the Korean people progress and prosperity.
					
					 He offered highest regard to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Russian Party and Swiss Figure
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Russian Party and Swiss Figure
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received gifts from the Maritime Territorial Branch of the United Russia Party and the chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 The gifts were conveyed to officials of the DPRK missions in relevant countries by Kurleyeva, member of the Regional Political Council of the Maritime Territorial Branch of the United Russia Party, and Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee and chief of the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, on Sept. 6 and 9.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans' Delegations Leave
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans' Delegations Leave 
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Delegations which took part in the celebrations in the 65th anniversary of the DPRK left here Saturday. They include a delegation of the General Association of Koreans in China, delegation of officials of the regional associations of the General Association led by Vice-Chairman of the General Association Choe Su Bong, delegation of Korean Artistes in China and delegation of the Association of Koreans for Economic and Cultural Exchange in Dandong, China led by Chairman Kim Thaek Ryong. 
					 Also departing here were the delegation of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan led by advisor An Pyong Ok, the delegation of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. led by Chairman Yun Kil Sang and the delegation of Federation of Koreans in Australia. 
					
					 Leaving earlier were the delegation of officials of Korean Commercial Associations in Japan led by Kim Myong Su, vice managing director of the Federation of Korean Men of Commerce in Japan, and the delegation of the Koreans Council in New Zealand led by Secretary General Kim Nam Su.

articles.title: Delegations of Juche Idea Study Organizations Leave
articles.content:
Delegations of Juche Idea Study Organizations Leave
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea led by Chairman Dmitri Kostenko and delegation of the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance of Pakistan led by Secretary General Javed Ahmed Ansari went back home Saturday. 
					 Earlier, the delegation of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy led by Chairman M. Jahangir Khan went back home. 
					
					 They took part in the celebrations of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.

articles.title: Delegation of Koreans in Japan Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Koreans in Japan Leaves
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Koreans in Japan led by Kwon Sun Hwi, advisor to the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, left here Saturday after taking part in the celebrations of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Urges S. Korean Authorities to Think Twice over Politically Motivated Farce
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Urges S. Korean Authorities to Think Twice over Politically Motivated Farce
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Recently the south Korean conservatives cooked up what they called plotted rebellion to kick up a whirlwind of suppression of a lawmaker from the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) and others concerned and deliberately linked them to the DPRK. 
					 Confrontation maniacs are crying out for clarifying any linkage of the UPP with the DPRK, asserting that "some forces formed an underground revolutionary organization guided by the Juche idea" and they are "forces keen to overthrow the social system in cooperation with the north". 
					
					 The world is stunned to see the south Korean regime kicking up a campaign of harsh suppression, slandering the north at a time when there is a positive sign of improving the north-south relations thanks to the DPRK's sincere efforts for national reconciliation and the improvement of the inter-Korean ties and the expectation and attention of public at home and abroad are focused on detente on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 This is another confrontation farce going against the trend of the times towards democracy in south Korean society and north-south dialogue and improved inter-Korean ties and an unpardonable challenge to the DPRK's will to mend the ties. 
					
					 The Intelligence Service should be brought to justice for its interference in the "election." It, however, is making much fuss about the plotted rebellion under the wire-pulling of the south Korean authorities. Even prosecution and conservative media patronized by the "Saenuri Party" are busy kicking up a row about the disclosure of "the north-linked force to overthrow the system". 
					
					 It is a well-known fact that the successive fascist dictators of south Korea fabricated shocking "spy cases" and groundlessly linked them with the DPRK to mercilessly suppress the progressive forces calling for independence, democracy and reunification whenever they were driven into a ruling crisis. The brutal suppression of those related to the UPP is little different from the military dictators' crackdown in their methods. 
					
					 South Korean public protests this repressive campaign, holding that the authorities chose the old method of trumpeting about the theory of coloring and suppression under the pretext of security in a bid to clear the suspicion of the fraudulent "presidential election" and no matter how desperately they suppress the people at the point of bayonet as they did in the 1970s, they can never gag the people. 
					
					 They can never tide over their political crisis, a product of confrontation and dictatorial rule, with an anachronistic political farce. 
					
					 The fascist confrontation maniacs are seriously mistaken if they calculate they can stifle the pro-reunification patriotic forces, progressive and democratic forces in south Korea and torpedo the process for improving the north-south relations and stem the trend of the times in the vicinity of Korea with such despicable plots. 
					
					 Now all Koreans and international community support the DPRK's sincere efforts for detente on the Korean Peninsula and in the region and watch with vigilance the south Korean puppet authorities' acts of treachery going against them. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities' behavior paying lip-service to dialogue and slandering their dialogue partner behind the scene and inciting confrontation would only stoke distrust and confrontation between compatriots and adversely affect the hard-won atmosphere of dialogue. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should think twice over the catastrophic consequences of confrontation between fellow countrymen and stop at once all acts getting on the nerves of the dialogue partner. 
					
					 They would be well advised to draw a serious lesson from the history of the north-south relations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Advancing along Road of Independence, Songun and Socialism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Advancing along Road of Independence, Songun and Socialism
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The road of independence, Songun and socialism is the path covered by the Korean revolution winning one victory after another and the one of advance to be followed by it to the end in the future, too, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an editorial.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Dynamic advance along the road of independence, Songun and socialism provides a sure guarantee for successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Independence, Songun and socialism were the revolutionary creed and leadership principles consistently adhered to by them all their lives.
					
					 Dynamic advance along the road of independence, Songun and socialism also provides a sure guarantee for fully demonstrating the dignity and spirit of the great Paektusan nation and increasing its might in every way.
					
					 Invariable is the path of victory for giving fullest play to the dignity of the great Paektusan nation and national power in the new century of Juche.
					
					 The above-said dynamic advance also provides a firm guarantee for achieving the happiness of the Korean people and the prosperity of the generations to come.
					
					 Everything for the people and future was the objective of the socialist construction the Workers' Party of Korea put forward when covering the untrodden path of the revolution and remains the signpost for building a thriving nation.
					
					  The Korean people have dynamically advanced along the road of victory of socialism, increasing the might of Songun in every way under the uplifted banner of self-reliance. They will certainly demonstrate their might as a dignified and heroic people and build the best power in the world.

articles.title: Japan's Alarming Military Spending under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Alarming Military Spending under Fire 
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The Defense Ministry of Japan will increase the defense budget for next year 3 percent over this year's, according to recent foreign press reports, This will be the biggest in 22 years. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This fact goes to prove that the Japanese reactionaries are working with blood-shot eyes to turn Japan into a military giant and launch reinvasion. 
					
					 The Japanese warlike forces' plan to spend exorbitant amount of funds for defense are a part of the moves to make Japan veer to the Right and realize militarization. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have so far spent a huge amount of funds as military expenditure to equip the "Self-Defense Forces" with modern military hardware and latest war technology. As a result, the SDF emerged dangerous aggression forces capable of conducting military operations in any part of the world. 
					
					 These days the Japanese reactionaries spend a stupendous amount of funds for the introduction of Global Hawk drones, F-35s and other fighters. 
					
					 Some time ago, Japan launched an escort ship Izumo carrying copters to beef up the Maritime Self-Defense Force. 
					
					 The reactionaries do not hide their plan to introduce new transport plane Osprey into the SDF in 2015. It will spend about 100 million yen for its research only. 
					
					 All these moves for arms buildup are not of defensive nature but for aggression from A to Z. Herein lie the gravity and danger of the moves. 
					
					 They would be well advised to behave themselves, mindful that reinvasion is bound to lead to doom.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Dropping Confrontational Concept
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Dropping Confrontational Concept
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Confrontational concept is quite contrary to the present era in which all the Koreans aspire after national reconciliation and unity and this concept is the leftovers of the old era that should be removed at an early date to improve the north-south ties and achieve independent reunification of the country and prosperity common to the nation, says Rodong Sinmun in an article Saturday.
					 It is a matter of overriding importance to get rid of the narrow-minded concept of confrontation that goes against reunification, now that the atmosphere of improving the north-south ties is being created, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Insistence on one's own assertions to meet one's own interests in disregard of the interests of the nation will create great difficulties in the way of improving the north-south ties.
					
					 Habits practiced in the confrontation era can cause repugnance and inspire the idea of ignoring the other party rather than the feelings of familiarity.
					
					 But nothing will be problem if one is committed to ending confrontation.
					
					 No problem will be insoluble if one is constant in one's attitude and stand to advance dialogue, cooperation and reunification together with the fellow countrymen of the same blood, away from the feelings of mistrust and confrontation, as the Korean nation's homogeneity remains unchanged.
					
					 This is evidenced by the fact that the north and the south successfully concluded the working-level talks for the normalization of the Kaesong Industrial Zone despite turns and twists and adopted an agreement for the reunions of separated families and relatives.
					
					 When the Koreans in the north and the south pool their creative ingenuity and wisdom and fully tap their potentials, Korea can emerge as an advanced and powerful country that leads the world.
					
					 No one can replace the Korean nation in reunifying the country. It is none other than the Koreans who desire for reunification being responsible for it and it is also the Koreans who will benefit from it.

articles.title: Minju Joson Flays U.S. Espionage in Space
articles.content:
Minju Joson Flays U.S. Espionage in Space
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the U.S. launched one more spy satellite from its Vandenberg Air Force Base in California State. The U.S. National Reconnaissance Office which supervised this launch only claimed that it is a project for "supporting the national defense" but didn't clarify the activities and mission of the spy satellite and its scientific and technological performance, etc. at all.
					 Minju Joson Saturday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 It is as clear as a pikestaff that the spy satellite would be used for the purpose of the aggressive and warlike foreign policy of the U.S. aiming to dominate the world.
					
					 The U.S. is attaching weighty significance to the speed and scientific accuracy in collecting information to carry out its aggressive foreign policy. It is paying special attention to rounding off the intelligence-gathering system by spy satellites.
					
					 Hence, the U.S. is keen to cover the space with a dense network of its spy satellites and hold supremacy in this aspect, too.
					
					 It is by no means accidental that some time ago the U.S. launched two "SM-6" interceptor missiles from its navy ship "Chancellorsville".
					
					 It is the military strategic scenario of the U.S. to take an unchallenged edge in the field of strategic and offensive weapons by combining the intelligence-gathering system by spy satellites and the interceptor missile system.
					
					 The U.S. intention to attain military supremacy is a dangerous and foolish act to expand the arms race to space.
					
					 The U.S. criminal scenario to turn peaceful space into a theatre of arms race, theatre of war is bound to meet the judgment of justice.

articles.title: DPRK Makes Big Effort to Educational Work
articles.content:
DPRK Makes Big Effort to Educational Work
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea directs big effort to putting school and public education and all other educational works on a higher level, after setting it as a main goal for building a knowledge-based economic power to educate all the people to be well versed in science and technology.
					 A brisk work is going on to improve educational contents and methods in the field of general education.
					
					 New textbooks have been prepared at the final stage for the universal compulsory 12-year education system, which will be enforced in the country from Juche 103 (2014).
					
					 Various forms of teaching courses were organized on a nationwide scale to create new teaching methods and generalize them.
					
					 Secondary schools were divided into junior and senior secondary schools and, accordingly, more schools have been built under the support of the government.
					
					 Giving deep attention to the construction of news schools, people's committees in provinces and counties have taken steps to provide all schools with enough experimental apparatuses and athletic equipment and goods.
					
					 Efforts have been made to reinforce educational facilities and improve the quality of education in the field of higher education, too.
					
					 A new modern library has taken its shape at Pyongyang Medical College under Kim Il Sung University. Meanwhile, the construction of such libraries is going at the final stage at Hamhung University of Chemical Engineering, Hamhung University of Medicine and Chongjin University of Mining and Metallurgy.
					
					 Some universities opened new faculties and courses to intensify the education in ultra-modern technology in keeping with the demand of the present times, thus raising the level of the higher education system.
					
					 The Central Information Agency for Science and Technology and the Grand People's Study House established a system of providing people with new technologies in real time.
					
					 Kim Chaek University of Technology and other universities have introduced the tele-education system to 130 odd industrial establishments, including the Chollima Steel Complex and the Pyongyang Essential Foodstuff Factory.
					
					 Meanwhile, programs of Ryongnamsan, a TV channel dealing with information on nature and society for students and other people, are being steadily improved.
					
					 A great effort has also been directed to the work for putting education on an IT basis.

articles.title: Defense Minister of S. Korea Slammed for His Reckless Anti-DPRK Remarks
articles.content:
Defense Minister of S. Korea Slammed for His Reckless Anti-DPRK Remarks
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Kwan Jin, puppet defense minister of south Korea, addressing a recent international military seminar blustered that "one should know provocation and threat would bring nothing", again raising a hue and cry over "the nuclear and missile threats from the north".
					 At a military commanders' meeting held earlier, he made such bellicose and hysteric remarks that "there was a precedent of the north's provocation in the past period of dialogue", crying out for "maintaining full military readiness even at the phase of dialogue."
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Such provocative remarks can be made only by the man persistently seeking the tension between the north and the south and working with bloodshot eyes to escalate it.
					
					 Kim Kwan Jin is a confrontation maniac steeped in hostility towards the DPRK to the marrow of his bones though it is a dialogue partner.
					
					 People still remember the fact that the inter-Korean military talks disappointed all the compatriots desirous of dialogue, improved relations and national reunification when he served as the defense minister during the Lee Myung Bak regime.
					
					 What Kim vociferated about is nothing but anti-reunification and bellicose behavior to stem the trend of dialogue and detente and escalate the confrontation and tension.
					
					 He would be well advised to stop going reckless, bearing in mind that his remarks will only bring into bolder relief his despicable true colors as a warmonger.

articles.title: Distortion of History by S. Korean Authorities Slammed
articles.content:
Distortion of History by S. Korean Authorities Slammed
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- South Korean scholars of the Institute of Historic Affairs, the Institute for National Studies and other institutes held a meeting in Seoul on Tuesday in denunciation of the puppet authorities' distortion of history.
					 They referred to the recent screening by the Committee for Compiling History Textbooks of history textbook written by neo-conservative historians.
					
					 The textbook has hundreds of errors and embellishes the past colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists based on the "theory of modernizing the colony," in particular, they charged.
					
					 They criticized the authors of the textbook for eulogizing dictators like Syngman Rhee and Park Chung-Hee and distorting and downplaying the movement for democracy.
					
					 They declared that they would conduct positive campaign to correct the errors of the textbook.

articles.title: S. Korean Catholics Demand Probe into Truth behind IS's Interference in Election
articles.content:
S. Korean Catholics Demand Probe into Truth behind IS's Interference in Election 
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- South Korean Catholics held a press conference outside the office building of the "Saenuri Party" in Youido, Seoul on Wednesday. 
					 They made public a declaration on the situation demanding a probe into the truth behind the puppet Intelligence Service's illegal interference in the election and punishment of its masterminds.
					
					 The declaration chided the chief executive of south Korea for still keeping mum about the IS case. 
					
					 All the facts disclosed so far through the investigations clearly prove that the IS violated the "election law" and interfered in politics and police plotted to cover up the facts, it said, and continued:
					
					 Truth is bound to be probed more clearly and those involved in the case are sure to be punished soon. 
					
					 Speakers at the press conference declared that they would stage actions together with more believers till their demand is met, if the "government" and "Saenuri Party" do not change the attitude toward probing the truth behind the case and punishing the chief culprits.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Patronizing IS
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Patronizing IS
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity Council of Civic and Public Organizations in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Thursday denouncing the puppet authorities for patronizing the Intelligence Service (IS) in its illegal acts.
					 Speakers said at the press conference that people of different social standings staged actions in demand of probe into the truth about the IS's interference in the presidential election, but the ruling party and the present chief executive are taking the lead in shielding the IS far from probing the truth about the case.
					
					 They queried is it normal way of thinking to label those opposed to the project for four big rivers "forces following the north" and paint interference in the election as "act for security".
					
					 Once again demanding the probe into the truth about the case and the punishment of the chief culprit, they declared that they would carry on their actions together with the people desirous of democracy.

articles.title: S. Korean District Court Suppresses Civilian for Praising North
articles.content:
S. Korean District Court Suppresses Civilian for Praising North
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Jonju District Court of south Korea Wednesday sentenced a civilian to a prison term on the charge of violating the "security law", according to Yonhap News of south Korea. 
					 He posted on his PC and internet homepage more than 60 articles praising and supporting the DPRK in July and November of 2010. The court imposed the penalty upon him, charging him with producing and distributing "materials benefiting the enemy".

articles.title: Catholic Parish in S. Korea Calls for Probing Truth behind IS's Interference in Election
articles.content:
Catholic Parish in S. Korea Calls for Probing Truth behind IS's Interference in Election
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The Pusan Catholic Parish in south Korea held a "mass on the situation for denouncing Intelligence Service's illegal interference in the election and restoring democracy" in Pusan on September 9. It released a declaration on the situation there.
					 Those related to the IS's case in Chongwadae and "Saenuri Party", IS and police have taken such arrogant attitude as keeping mum about it, bearing false witness and refusing to make testimonies in a bid to conceal the truth behind it, the declaration charged.
					
					 It accused them of making reckless remarks, terming the IS's illegal interference in the election part of "psychological warfare against the north". 
					
					 It denounced them for not reflecting on their crimes but trying to cover up the truth through all sorts of base acts.
					
					 The present chief executive of south Korea should be held responsible for the illegal acts of the IS, police and "Saenuri Party", it stressed.

articles.title: Candlelight Rally Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Candlelight Rally Held in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- A candlelight rally took place at Seoul Square Friday in protest against the south Korean Intelligence Service's fabrication of plotted rebellion. It was sponsored by the Emergency Council to Denounce IS's Political Operation and Its Interference in Presidential Election.
					 It was attended by people from all walks of life in Seoul and from different places, members of opposition parties and other personages, more than 30,000 in all.
					
					 Speakers held that the case of plotted rebellion was cooked up by the IS to get rid of the catastrophic crisis, adding that lurking behind this is its sinister intention to blow up candlelight.
					
					 Those charged with involvement in the case have dedicated themselves to social progress, calling for the abrogation of the "security law", they noted.
					
					 They accused the IS of suppressing them to cover up its illegal acts.
					
					 Many people are branding the case as an anachronistic one, they said, calling for probing the truth behind all the illegal acts of the IS through candlelight actions.
					
					 They declared they would carry on their candlelight actions despite the IS's suppression.

articles.title: Japan's Apology and Reparation Urged
articles.content:
Japan's Apology and Reparation Urged
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The 1091st Wednesday rally was held in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul on Sept. 11 to demand the Japanese government settle the issue of sexual slavery for the imperial Japanese army.
					 It was sponsored by the "Kansai Network for Solving the Issue of Comfort Women for the Imperial Japanese Army," the Japanese civic organization.
					
					 Present at the rally were members of the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea, victims of the sexual slavery, Koreans in Japan, Japanese figures and U.S. religionists.
					
					 A statement was read out at the rally.
					
					 The statement charged that during the Second World War Japan took lots of women to the battle fields for aggression, deprived them of their freedom and inflicted unimaginable pains on them.
					
					 Even though 21 years have passed since the first Wednesday rally, Japan still refuses to make an apology and reparation for them, persistently denying its crimes, it held.
					
					 On the contrary, the Japanese ruling forces are revealing the ambition to revive militarism, distorting the history and vociferating about the revision of the pacifist Constitution, it noted.
					
					 The statement urged the Japanese government to admit its past crimes and make an apology and reparation for them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Talk Carried by Ugandan Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Talk Carried by Ugandan Newspaper
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The Ugandan paper Sun Rise on September 6 allotted one whole page to the full text of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's talk "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution."  The talk was published in Rodong Sinmun, organ of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Joson Inmingun, organ of the Korean People's Army, on the Day of Songun, August 25, Juche 102 (2013).
					 The talk deals with the Songun revolutionary feats of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and clarifies the essence and originality of the idea of the Songun revolution and the tasks to be carried out to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Songun.
					
					 The paper carried a photo of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Norway, Sweden, Iceland and Poland on September 5 and 6 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Present there were figures of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, the Ostfold Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Communist Party in Sweden, the Communist Party of Sweden, the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society and the Poland-Korea Association and masses.
					
					 Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, said that President Kim Il Sung was the founder of the DPRK.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the President set forth a nation-building line suited to the actual conditions of Korea, wisely led the struggle for successfully carrying out the democratic reforms and provided a firm foundation for founding the DPRK.
					
					 He stressed that the President founded the DPRK on September 9, 1948 on the basis of it.
					
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, noted that the founding of the DPRK realized the desire of the Korean people to become the masters of a sovereign state, opened a bright prospect for carving out their destiny and future and greatly encouraged the peoples of the whole world in their struggle against colonialism and imperialism and for national independence.
					
					 Jon Arni Halldorsson, general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society, said that the DPRK brought about centuries-old changes under the outstanding and seasoned guidance of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to supreme leader Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Norway and Sweden.

articles.title: Chinese Newspaper Introduces DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Newspaper Introduces DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The Chinese paper People's Daily on September 9 carried an article titled "DPRK dynamically propelling constructions of various projects" on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The paper said:
					
					 September 9 marks the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 To greet this auspicious holiday the DPRK is dynamically accelerating economic construction in conformity with the actual situation of the country under the guidance of its party and government.
					
					 The "Speed on Masik Pass" is the historical term in wide use in the DPRK today.
					
					 The DPRK tries to enrich the cultural life of the popular masses by building a ski resort in the area of Masik Pass near Wonsan.
					
					 Korean people are now working hard in various construction sites.
					
					 It gave a detailed account of the fact that the army and people of the DPRK have dynamically stepped up the projects in various parts of the country conducive to the building of an economic power and improvement of the people's living standard at the said speed under the leadership of the party.
					
					 It also dealt with a series of measures taken by the DPRK government for speeding up the building of an economic power.

articles.title: Figures of Myanmar Congratulate Korean People
articles.content:
Figures of Myanmar Congratulate Korean People
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Than Tun, general director for Administrative Affairs of the Union of Myanmar Economic Holdings Limited, and Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, separately released statements on September 5 and 6 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They extended warm congratulations to all Korean people on the occasion.
					
					 They said:
					
					 By founding the DPRK President Kim Il Sung enabled the Korean people to emerge the most independent and creative people in the world. The DPRK turned into an invincible power in which all people are united as one and which has powerful military muscle under the wise guidance of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people, has wisely led the Workers' Party and people of Korea to build a thriving nation and achieve national reunification by successfully carrying forward the ideas and cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Socialism in DPRK Praised by Finnish Party Leader
articles.content:
Socialism in DPRK Praised by Finnish Party Leader 
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Tommi Lievemaa, vice-chairman of the Finnish Communists' League who participated in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, contributed a travelogue on the DPRK to the Finnish paper Kansan Eeni on September 3.
					 The travelogue said:
					
					 My visit to the DPRK was a trip completely different from tours of other countries as I was born and grew up in a capitalist country.
					
					 The propaganda of the West about the DPRK is full of lies.
					
					 I strongly felt this at the very moment I arrived at the DPRK.
					
					 I know about the DPRK only through what I have listened to broadcasting services and read on newspapers. So, what I saw in that country including a grandiose parade, fascinating grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" and opening ceremony of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, etc. baffled my imagination.
					
					 My visit to the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun where President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il lie in state offered me an important opportunity to think a lot.
					
					 One may call the International Friendship Exhibition House which houses gifts to the leaders of the DPRK from heads of state and prominent figures of many countries of the world an edifice which bears witness to humankind's reverence and praise of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The appearance of the Korean people full of optimism and joy was true as no one can force those things upon them and fabricate them.
					
					 Streets looked neat and tidy though there were not dazzling advertisement boards.
					
					 The DPRK is a country free from pollution and taxes.
					
					 The country where free education and free medical service are enforced provides dwelling houses to people free of charge and jobs to them.
					
					 In the DPRK I could hardly find something symbolic of a capitalist society such as sense of oppression resulting from unstable future employment, uneasiness about joblessness, worries about houses and money and fear of violence, etc.
					
					 I think that one should go to the DPRK if one wishes to know about the superiority of socialism to capitalism.
					
					 The sovereignty of the country belongs to all people and they carve out their future themselves and fully enjoy genuine freedom, concluded the travelogue.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On the Juche Idea" was published in pamphlet by the Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries on September 6.
					 The work, published on March 31, Juche 71 (1982), clarifies the immortal historic feats President Kim Il Sung performed by founding the Juche idea, its significance and founding. It also deals with the philosophical principle, socio-historical principles, guiding principles of the Juche idea and its historical significance.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador de la RPDC en Angola
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador de la RPDC en Angola
Pyongyang, 14 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Segun el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Hyon Il fue designado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC a acreditarse en la Republica de Angola.

articles.title: Tendra lugar IX Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Tendra lugar IX Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 14 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Se realizara del dia 23 al 26 en la capitalina Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la IX Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang con la participacion de las companias comerciales de 13 paises y regiones incluyendo la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, China, Rusia, Alemania, Malasia, Mongolia y Polonia.
					En el certamen se expondran las maquinas herramientas CNC, mercancias electricas, electronicas, materiales de construccion, productos quimicos, los de la industria ligera, alimentos, aparatos medicos, medicinas y medios de transporte.
					
					  La presente exposicion contribuira a profundizar las relaciones de buena vecindad y amistad y realizar el intercambio y la cooperacion economica multilaterales y dinamicas negociaciones comerciales entre los paises. 
					
					Las exposiciones internacionales de mercancias de Pyongyang contribuyeron en el pasado a profundizar mas la confianza mutua entre la RPDC y varios paises y regiones del mundo y realizar el anhelo de la humanidad de vivir en el mundo pacifico.

articles.title: Resultados de segunda jornada del campeonato de levantamiento de pesas
articles.content:
Resultados de segunda jornada del campeonato de levantamiento de pesas
Pyongyang, 14 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Los resultados de los juegos de la segunda jornada (dia 13) del campeonato de levantamiento de pesas por la copa asiatica y de clubes de los jovenes y adultos de 2013 son siguientes:
					
					Division de 56kg (m) de categoria juvenil por la copa asiatica:
						
					
					Arranque
					
					1. Kwak Un Bom (RPDC)            107 kg
					
					2. Chetia Apurba (India)            101 kg
					
					3. Pak Myong Gyol (RPDC)         100 kg
						
					
					Envion
					
					1. Kwak Un Bom (RPDC)            135 kg
					
					2. Pak Myong Gyol (RPDC)         131 kg
					
					3. Chetia Apurba (India)            129 kg
						
					
					Total 
					
					1. Kwak Un Bom (RPDC)             242 kg
					
					2. Pak Myong Gyol (RPDC)          231 kg
					
					3. Chetia Apurba (India)             230 kg
						
					
					Division de 56kg (m) de categoria juvenil de campeonato de clubes:
						
					
					Arranque
					
					1. Jon Ho Gyong (RPDC)             108 kg
					
					2. O Kum Gwang (RPDC)             107 kg
					
					3. Chetia Apurba (India)             101 kg
						
					
					Envion 
					
					1. O Kum Gwang (RPDC)              138 kg
					
					2. Jon Ho Gyong (RPDC)              135 kg
					
					3. Chetia Apurba (India)              129 kg
						
					
					Total 
					
					1. O Kum Gwang (RPDC)              245 kg
					
					2. Jon Ho Gyong (RPDC)              243 kg
					
					3. Chetia Apurba (India)              230 kg
						
					
					Division de 62kg (m) de categoria juvenil por la copa asiatica:
						
					
					Arranque
					
					1. Kwon Yong Gwang (RPDC)         122 kg
					
					2. Ri Chol Hak (RPDC)                 116 kg
					
					3. Aboi Ramanov (Kirguizistan)      110 kg
						
					
					Envion
					
					1. Ri Chol Hak (RPDC)                 142 kg
					
					2. Sahu Achutananda (India)          136 kg
					
					3. Aboi Ramanov (Kirguizistan)      130 kg
						
					
					Total 
					
					1. Ri Chol Hak (RPDC)                  258 kg
					
					2. Sahu Achutananda (India)           241 kg
					
					3. Aboi Ramanov (Kirguizistan)       240 kg
						
					
					Division de 62kg (m) de categoria juvenil de campeonato de clubes:
						
					
					Arranque
					
					1. O Kang Chol (RPDC)                 125 kg
					
					2. Jo Un Gwang (RPDC)                 115 kg
					
					3. Aboi Ramanov (Kirguizistan)       110 kg
						
					
					Envion
					
					1. O Kang Chol (RPDC)                  145 kg
					
					2. Sahu Achutananda (India)            136 kg
					
					3. Jo Un Gwang (RPDC)                  131 kg
						
					
					Total
					
					1. O Kang Chol (RPDC)                   270 kg
					
					2. Jo Un Gwang (RPDC)                   246 kg
					
					3. Sahu Achutananda (India)             241 kg
						
					
					Division de 69kg (m) de categoria juvenil por la copa asiatica:
						
					
					Arranque
					
					1. Youssef A. Bordbar (Kuwait)          70 kg
					
					2. Mahdy W. Mohammad (Kuwait)        65 kg
						
					
					Envion 
					
					1. Kim Song Chol (RPDC)                  166 kg
					
					2. Youssef A. Bordbar (Kuwait)           87 kg
					
					3. Mahdy W. Mohammad (Kuwait)         70 kg
						
					
					Total 
					
					1. Youssef A. Bordbar (Kuwait)           157 kg
					
					2. Mahdy W. Mohammad (Kuwait)         135 kg
						
					
					Division de 69kg (m) de categoria juvenil de campeonato de clubes:
						
					
					Arranque
					
					1. Bunsuk Trirat (Tailandia)              132 kg
					
					2. Pak Ju Myong (RPDC)                   127 kg
					
					3. Ri Chol Byok (RPDC)                    120 kg
						
					
					Envion
					
					1. Bunsuk Trirat (Tailandia)             165 kg
					
					2. Pak Ju Myong (RPDC)                  161 kg
					
					3. Ri Chol Byok (RPDC)                  145 kg
						
					
					Total 
					
					1. Bunsuk Trirat (Tailandia)              297 kg
					
					2. Pak Ju Myong (RPDC)                   288 kg
					
					3. Ri Chol Byok (RPDC)                   265 kg
						
					
					Division de 77kg (m) de categoria juvenil por la copa asiatica:
						
					
					Arranque
					
					1. Choe Jon Wi (RPDC)                    152 kg
					
					2. Ragala Venkat Rahul (India)          140 kg
					
					3. Ri Song Hyok (RPDC)                   130 kg
						
					
					Envion
					
					1. Choe Jon Wi (RPDC)                    180 kg
					
					2. Nabiev Fayzullo (Uzbekistan)         161 kg
					
					3. Ragala Venkat Rahul (India)          161 kg
						
					
					Total 
					
					1. Choe Jon Wi (RPDC)                    332 kg
					
					2. Ragala Venkat Rahul (India)          301 kg
					
					3. Ri Song Hyok (RPDC)                   290 kg
						
					
					Division de 77kg (m) de categoria juvenil de campeonato de clubes:
						
					
					Arranque
					
					1. Jon Myong Song (RPDC)               142 kg
					
					2. Ragala Venkat Rahul (India)          140 kg
					
					3. Pak Chol Myong (RPDC)               135 kg
						
					
					Envion
					
					1. Jon Myong Song (RPDC)                175 kg
					
					2. Pak Chol Myong (RPDC)                166 kg
					
					3. Nabiev Fayzullo (Uzbekistan)         161 kg
						
					
					Total 
					
					1. Jon Myong Song (RPDC)                317 kg
